registers.name: BOOT_CFG
registers.description: Boot Configuration

bitfields.name: BOOT_SRC
bitfields.description: Primary boot source

values.name: SECONDARY_BOOTLOADER
values.description: Secondary Boot loader in Bank1 IFR0 (32KB)

bitfields.name: ISP_BOOT_IF
bitfields.description: ISP boot interface

bitfields.name: REC_BOOT_SRC
bitfields.description: Recovery boot source

values.name: SB3_IMAGE
values.description: SB3 image in 1-bit SPI flash connected to FlexComm. FC7 used for this function by default overlappes with FlexSPI A

bitfields.name: BOOT_SPEED
bitfields.description: Boot speed. Selects the core frequency and voltage to use during ROM execution

bitfields.name: HEADER
bitfields.description: CMPA Header marker should be set to 0x5963. After this header is set, all non-zero values will take effect; leaving all settings at 0xff will cause undefined behavior. It is recommended to set all values to 0x00 before setting the CMPA header value

registers.name: FLASH_CFG
registers.description: Flash Configuration

bitfields.name: FLASH_REMAP_SIZE
bitfields.description: Flash remap size. FLASH_REMAP_SIZE defines the size of the secondary boot image (the range of flash addresses that will be remapped)in internal flash, where remapped address end = (FLASH_REMAP_SIZE + 1)

bitfields.name: OEM_BANK1_IFR0_PROT
bitfields.description: Defines flash protection of Bank1_IFR0 area based on usage. Note, if the SBL / Recovery image size is more than IFR0 size of 32KB then sectors from user flash can be associated for extended image size using CMPA.REC_IMG_EXT0/1

values.name: OEM_ROM_RWXL_CODE
values.description: Not determined by ROM (MBC fields are modified by OEM code)

values.name: OEM_ROOT_RWXL_1010
values.description: Used as OEM Root of Trust image, in other words secondary boot loader (OEM_SBL). MBC protection bits set as RWXL = 1010. Updatable by OEM code later

values.name: OEM_SBL_RWXL_1011
values.description: Used as OEM_SBL. MBC protection bits set as RWXL = 1011

values.name: OEM_SBL_RWXL_0011
values.description: Used as OEM_SBL. MBC protection bits set as RWXL = 0011

values.name: OEM_REC_RWXL_1010
values.description: Used as OEM recovery boot image with MBC protection RWXL = 1010 on ROM exiting to recovery image. But set to RWXL = 1010 on ROM exiting to user image

values.name: OEM_REC_RWXL_1011
values.description: Used as OEM_RCVRY_IMG with MBC protection RWXL = 1010 on ROM exiting to recovery image. But set to RWXL = 1011 on ROM exiting to user image

values.name: OEM_REC_RWXL_0011
values.description: Used as OEM_RCVRY_IMG with MBC protection RWXL = 1010 on ROM exiting to recovery image. But set to RWXL = 0011 on ROM exiting to user image

values.name: OEM_REC_RWXL_0001
values.description: Used as OEM_RCVRY_IMG with MBC protection RWXL = 1010 on ROM exiting to recovery image. But set to RWXL = 0001 on ROM exiting to user image

bitfields.name: ISP_PIN_ENTRY
bitfields.description: Disable ISP mode entry through pin assertion

bitfields.name: ISP_DM_ENTRY
bitfields.description: Disable ISP mode entry through debug mailbox command

bitfields.name: ISP_API_ENTRY
bitfields.description: Disable ISP mode entry through ROM API call. ISP mode can be entered through ROM API invocation

bitfields.name: ISP_FT_ENTRY
bitfields.description: Disable ISP mode entry through image authentication failure

registers.name: BOOT_LED_STATUS
registers.description: Boot LED Status

bitfields.name: REC_BOOT_LED
bitfields.description: Assert on recovery boot. ROM drives the GPIO pin high, identified by this field whenever primary boot fails and fall through to recovery boot source. [4:0] GPIO Pin number. P0_0 and P0_1 are not supported. [7:5] GPIO port number. Only 0 - 4 ports are allowed. If this feature is not use then set this field to 0x00. If this feature is not use then set this field to 0x00

bitfields.name: ISP_BOOT_LED
bitfields.description: Assert on ISP fall through. ROM drives the GPIO pin high identified by this field whenever primary boot fails and execution falls through to ISP mode. [[4:0] GPIO Pin number. P0_0 and P0_1 are not supported. [7:5] GPIO port number. Only 0 - 4 ports are allowed. If this feature is not use then set this field to 0x00. If this feature is not use then set this field to 0x00

bitfields.name: BOOT_FAIL_LED
bitfields.description: Assert on fatal errors during boot. ROM drives the GPIO pin high identified by this field whenever primary boot fails due to fatal errors before locking-up/reset. [4:0] GPIO Pin number. P0_0 and P0_1 are not supported. [7:5] GPIO port number. Only 0 - 4 ports are allowed. If this feature is not use then set this field to 0x00. If this feature is not use then set this field to 0x00

registers.name: BOOT_TIMERS
registers.description: Boot Timers

bitfields.name: POWERDOWN_TIMEOUT_SECS
bitfields.description: Powerdown timeout: ISP mode peripheral detection timeout value in seconds. If a non-zero value is program and peripheral activity is not detected within the number of seconds specified here, then the device will go to power down mode to conserve power

bitfields.name: WDOG_TIMEOUT_COUNT
bitfields.description: WDOG timeout: Upper 16 bits of 24-bit count value in WWDT0_TC register Timeout value in seconds. The lower 8 bits of WWDT0_TC are set to 0. When a non-zero value is programmed in this field ROM configures the watch dog timer to reset the device on timeout before passing execution control to user code

registers.name: FLEXSPI_BOOT_CFG0
registers.description: FlexSPI Boot Configuration 0

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_AUTO_PROBE_EN
bitfields.description: Quad/Octal-SPI flash auto probe feature enable

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_PROBE_TYPE
bitfields.description: Quad/Octal-SPI flash probe type. Note, this field is used when FLEXSPI_AUTO_PROBE_EN is set

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_FLASH_TYPE
bitfields.description: Define typical Serial NOR Flash types. This field is always used irrespective of FLEXSPI_AUTO_PROBE_EN value

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_DUMMY_CYCLES
bitfields.description: Quad/Octal-SPI dummy cycles for read command. If a non-zero value is programmed in this field, then the value is used to override the default number of dummy cycles for a fast read command read from the serial flash’s SFDP information. Note: this field is only used if FLEXSPI_AUTO_PROBE_EN is set

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_FREQUENCY
bitfields.description: Quad/Octal-SPI flash interface frequency. Note, this field is used when FLEXSPI_AUTO_PROBE_EN is set

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_RESET_ENABLE
bitfields.description: Use O/QSPI_RESET_PIN to reset the flash device

values.name: NO_RESET
values.description: NO_RESET(O/QSPI device reset pin is not connected or available

values.name: EN_RESET
values.description: EN_RESET(O/QSPI device reset pin is connected to a GPIO (QSPI_RESET_PIN)

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_RESET_GPIO_PORT
bitfields.description: When FLEXSPI_RESET_ENABLE = 1, this field determines the GPIO port number to use for O/QSPI reset function

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_RESET_GPIO_PIN
bitfields.description: When FLEXSPI_RESET_ENABLE = 1, this field determines the GPIO pin number to use for O/QSPI reset function

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_HOLD_TIME
bitfields.description: Delay after reset before accessing Quad/Octal-SPI flash devices. Note, for POR in addition to this wait time FLEXSPI_PWR_HOLD_TIME is added

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_PWR_HOLD_TIME
bitfields.description: Delay after POR before accessing Quad/Octal-SPI flash devices in addition to delay defined by FLEXSPI_HOLD TIME field

bitfields.name: PORT_SEL
bitfields.description: Defines which FlexSPI portA/B is used for boot

registers.name: FLEXSPI_BOOT_CFG1
registers.description: FlexSPI Boot Configuration 1

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_DELAY_CELL_NUM
bitfields.description: Delay cell numbers for Flash read sampling via DQS (either internal loopback or external DQS). The value provided here is loaded into the FLEXSPIn_DLLnCR

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_IMAGE_OFFSET
bitfields.description: Any offset in memory mapped FlexSPI Flash area could be remapped to offset zero to support eXecute In Place (XIP) of image programmed at different offset. This allows to build all update images with same RO base address, which are programmed at offset 0 or higher offset. FLEXSPI_IMAGE_OFFSET field specifies the offset location of the second image. FLEXSPI_REMAP_IMAGE_SIZE field specifies the size multiple to determine the size of area to be remapped. If this field is left blank boot ROM will not enable FlexSPI remap feature. The physical flash offset is computed as below: physical offset = FLEXSPI_IMAGE_OFFSET

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_REMAP_IMAGE_SIZE
bitfields.description: Any offset in memory mapped FlexSPI Flash area could be remapped to offset zero to support eXecute In Place (XIP) of image programmed at different offset. This allows to build all update images with same RO base address, which are programmed at offset 0 or higher offset. FLEXSPI_IMAGE_OFFSET field specifies the offset location of second image. FLEXSPI_REMAP_IMAGE_SIZE field specifies the size multiple to determine the size of area to be remapped. NOTE: FlexSPI remap size cannot exceed the start address of boot image 1

values.name: SIZE_OFFSET
values.description: Remap size = FLEXSPI_IMAGE_OFFSET * 256KByte; '' SIZE_OFFSET ''Size of the remapped area (aka second half) is same as first half. It is determined by FLEXSPI_IMAGE_OFFSET Field

bitfields.description: USB PHY input clock frequency. For USB high speed PHY external XTAL input is needed. This field specifies the frequency of XTAL used on board. • 000b - 24MHz input clock (Divide by 20) • 001b - 30MHz input clock (Divide by 16) • 010b - 32MHz input clock (Divide by 15) • 011b - Reserved • 100b - 20MHz input clock (Divide by 24) • 101b - 19.2MHz input clock (Divide by 25) • 110b - 16MHz input clock (Divide by 30) - Default option when CMPA is blank. • 111b - 12MHz input clock (Divide by 40)

registers.description: Secure Boot Configuration

bitfields.name: SEC_BOOT_EN
bitfields.description: Secure boot enforcement. This field defines the minimum image verification procedure (CRC32, CMAC, ECDSA sign). The Image type field in header indicates the type of verification data (checksum or signature) included in it. Note: Plain < CRC32 < CMAC < ECDSA

values.name: CRC32_IMAGES
values.description: Only CRC32 or signed (CMAC or ECDSA) images are allowed

values.name: SIGNED_IMAGES
values.description: Only Signed (CMAC or ECDSA) images are allowed

values.name: ECDSA_SIGNED

bitfields.name: LP_SEC_BOOT
bitfields.description: Secure boot option for low-power wake from power-down and deep-powerdown. For CFPA/CMPA do CRC check always

values.name: CHECK_CRC32
values.description: CRC check for CFPA/CMPA & CRC32 check of active image

values.name: CHECK_JUMP
values.description: CRC check for CFPA/CMPA & jump to vector address specified in CFPA

values.name: CMAC_CHECK
values.description: CRC check for CFPA/CMPA & CMAC check of active image

bitfields.name: ENF_CNSA
bitfields.description: Enforce CNSA suite approved algorithms for secure boot, secure update and debug authentication. Note, CMAC image authentication is only allowed in 2b'00 setting

values.name: LIMITED_0B01
values.description: Only ECC P-384 keys, SHA384 & AES256 algorithms are used

values.name: LIMITED_0B10
values.description: Only ECC P-384 keys, SHA384 & AES256 algorithms are used

values.name: LIMITED_0B11

bitfields.name: ENF_TZM_PRESET

values.name: ENFORCE_0B10

values.name: ENFORCE_0B11

bitfields.name: ITRC_ZEROIZE
bitfields.description: RAM zeroize on ITRC event. Zeroize long-term storage RAM (RAMA) on subsequent boot when Intrusion and Tamper control signals an intrusion event (ITRC_OUT3). Note, when ITRC is re-configured in application then ITRC_OUT4 (CHIP_RESET) should be triggered with at least same events as ITRC_OUT3 (RAM_ZEROIZE)

values.name: PKC_RAM_ON_ITRC
values.description: Always Zeroize PKC RAM on ITRC event only

values.name: PKC_RAMA_ON_ITRC
values.description: Zeroize PKC & RAMA on ITRC event only

values.name: PKC_RAMA_ALL_RESET
values.description: Always Zeroize PKC & RAMA on all reset boot

values.name: FLASH_ACL_PROTECTION

values.name: NO_STICKY_LOCK
values.description: Write protect active image area without sticky lock. GLBAC4 is used. FLASH_ACL settings are ignored

values.name: XOM_PROTECTION
values.description: XOM protect active image area with sticky lock. GLBAC6 is used. FLASH_ACL settings are ignored

bitfields.name: REG0_ERASE_CHECK_EN
bitfields.description: Enable erase check for NPX PRINCE context 0. When erase check is enabled ROM API will enforce a check to guarantee that all sectors selected in the context are erased together. When erase check is enabled only contiguous sectors can be selected in context bitmap. 0x - ROM API will not perform erase check. 1x - ROM API will perform erase check. 0x - ROM API will not perform erase check

registers.name: REC_IMG_EXT0
registers.description: Bitmap mask to indicate sectors included in recovery image (sectors .Recovery image is programmed in BANK1_IFR0. But if the image size is more than 32KB, this field can be used to indicate sectors to include in recovery image.ROM will configure flash protection setting for these sectors the same as BANK1_IFR0 before exiting to user code. The protection settings are managed through CMPA.OEM_BANK1_IFR0_PROT. The lower 8 sectors are excluded from this mask to avoid conflicts with dual image boot feature.

registers.name: QUICK_SET_GPIO_0
registers.description: Drive GPIO 0 port [31:0] pins high after reset. Each bit corresponds to the pin in GPIO port 0. When set ROM drives the corresponding pin high as soon as possible. By default most pins come-up as tri-stated inputs. This feature allows customer to specify active drive pins soon after reset instead of waiting till complete boot. Note, if a pin is selected in both QUICK_SET_GPIO_0 and QUICK_CLR_GPIO_0 fields then pin will be set to high-level with quick transition to low.

registers.name: QUICK_CLR_GPIO_0
registers.description: Drive GPIO 0 port [31:0] pins low. Each bit corresponds to the pin in GPIO port 0. When set ROM drives the corresponding pin high as soon as possible. By default most pins come-up as tri-stated inputs. This feature allows customer to specify active drive pins soon after reset instead of waiting till complete boot. Note, if a pin is selected in both QUICK_SET_GPIO_0 and QUICK_CLR_GPIO_0 fields then pin will be set to high-level with quick transition to low.

registers.name: QUICK_SET_GPIO_1
registers.description: Drive GPIO 1 port [31:0] pins high after reset. Each bit corresponds to the pin in GPIO port 0. When set ROM drives the corresponding pin high as soon as possible. By default most pins come-up as tri-stated inputs. This feature allows customer to specify active drive pins soon after reset instead of waiting till complete boot. Note, if a pin is selected in both QUICK_SET_GPIO_1 and QUICK_CLR_GPIO_1 fields then pin will be set to high-level with quick transition to low.

registers.name: QUICK_CLR_GPIO_1
registers.description: Drive GPIO 1 port [31:0] pins low. Each bit corresponds to the pin in GPIO port 0. When set ROM drives the corresponding pin high as soon as possible. By default most pins come-up as tri-stated inputs. This feature allows customer to specify active drive pins soon after reset instead of waiting till complete boot. Note, if a pin is selected in both QUICK_SET_GPIO_1 and QUICK_CLR_GPIO_1 fields then pin will be set to high-level with quick transition to low.

registers.name: CUST_MK_SK_KEY_BLOB0
registers.description: CUST_MK_SK is stored in form of RFC3394 blob and it is used by bootloader to decrypt SB3.1 encryption key during processing of SB file by bootloader. CUST_MK_SK is generated during device provisioning process by HSM_KEY_GEN (random key) or by HSM_STORE_KEY (user defined key) commands. To store this key into CMPA, SB_STORE_KEY command should be used.

registers.name: CMPA_CRC32
registers.description: CRC32 of CMPA page data from offset . ROM updates this field along with CMPA_CMAC. ROM uses this field based on CMPA.LP_SEC_BOOT field option.

registers.description: CMAC[31:0] of CMPA page data from offset . ROM updates this field on subsequent boot after page update.
